# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10) 
    words = split(str, ' ')
    result = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(result) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        end
        
        result *= "$word "
    end
    
    return result
end
```

For example, when we call the function with a string and `text_width` equals to 10:
```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test string", 10))
```
We would expect an output similar to this:
```
"This is\na test\nstring"
```
